notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 102.9.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Incorrect code generation during JIT compilation (CVE-2023-25751)

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 111 and Firefox ESR 102.9 (CVE-2023-28176)

* Mozilla: Potential out-of-bounds when accessing throttled streams (CVE-2023-25752)

* Mozilla: Invalid downcast in Worklets (CVE-2023-28162)

* Mozilla: URL being dragged from a removed cross-origin iframe into the same tab triggered navigation (CVE-2023-28164)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

An attacker could construct a PKCS 12 cert bundle in such a way that could allow for arbitrary memory writes via PKCS 12 Safe Bag attributes being mishandled.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nss: Arbitrary memory write via PKCS 12
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Firefox and Thunderbird in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 and later are not affected by this vulnerability, as they use the system NSS library. Firefox and Thunderbird in earlier Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 extended life streams were affected, and should be updated to fixed versions as they become available.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: nss: Arbitrary memory write via PKCS 12

cwe.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of invalidating JIT code while following an iterator. The newly generated code could be overwritten incorrectly, leading to a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Incorrect code generation during JIT compilation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Incorrect code generation during JIT compilation

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue that when accessing throttled streams, the count of available bytes needs to be checked in the calling function to be within bounds. This may have led future code to be incorrect and vulnerable.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Potential out-of-bounds when accessing throttled streams
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Potential out-of-bounds when accessing throttled streams

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

While implementing AudioWorklets, some code may have cast one type to another, invalid, dynamic type. This could have led to a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory described the issue of dragging a URL from a cross-origin iframe that was removed during the drag could have led to user confusion and website spoofing attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory described the issue in which Mozilla developers Timothy Nikkel, Andrew McCreight, and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 110 and ESR 102.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption, and we presume that with enough effort, some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 111 and Firefox ESR 102.9
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
